image.altText: Pink diggers on Central Coast beach, pine trees in the background

props.synopsis: A bomb cyclone off the NSW coast is bringing hazardous surf conditions, strong winds and heavy rain that threatens to cause flash flooding. Follow live.

title.children: Flash flooding warning for Newcastle and Sydney as 'bomb cyclone' moves south

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: A Melbourne man has been charged with 70 offences related to eight alleged victims between April 2022 and January 2023.

title.children: Infectious diseases testing urged for 1,200 children after childcare arrest

image.altText: Man wearing a suit and black jacket standing next to a wall.

props.synopsis: There have been more than 2,000 fatal overdoses in Australia for the 10th year in a row, according to a new analysis by the Penington Institute.

title.children: The 'huge' Aussie death toll that gets 'very little attention'

image.altText: Senator Paul Scarr holds 30 year old parliamentary recommendations as he speaks on whistleblowers

props.synopsis: After the Department of Home Affairs conceded it had not been able to use laws that would see former immigration detainees placed back in detention, the Coalition has called for those laws to be amended.

title.children: Coalition demands rewrite of laws to re-detain NZYQ members

image.altText: Donald Trump close up with two men behind him

props.synopsis: After just five months in power, US President Donald Trump predictably has driven a wrecking ball through the foundations of American society. In recent weeks, he's re-opened an old front from his first term, the independence of the US Federal Reserve.

title.children: Is Trump about to create the next great financial crisis?

image.altText: Donald Trump stands looking down with a frown. Behind him large US flags hang behind pillars at the White House.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's attempt to "make America wealthy again" by imposing tariffs put the world on the brink of a financial crisis. With a three-month pause ending within days, trade experts are warning the global economy could be plunged into turmoil.

title.children: 'It's a very strange strategy': Trump's tariffs are backfiring on the US economy

image.altText: Picture of Australian one dollar coins stacked on top of note currency

props.synopsis: The local currency surges through a key resistance level, climbing to 65.8 US cents, while Wall Street closes out the financial year by hitting a new record. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX climbs as Aussie dollar jumps close to eight-month high

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ANZ-Roy Morgan consumer confidence survey: confidence rises a little
'It's not me, it's you': Aussie dollar rallies on US weakness
ASX gains on open, CBA falls further from record high

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a suit at a microphone in front of a wall of plants.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says the government is using all of its "assets" in the US to give Australia a leg up with the Trump administration. Follow live.

title.children: PM using all of Australia's 'assets' to engage more with Trump

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Albanese using Australia's 'assets' in US to get an in with Trump
Will the PM convene a national cabinet meeting on deaths in custody?
Trump has been 'respectful of me': PM

image.altText: Woman wearing a black mask and sewing a pile of cargo pants.

props.synopsis: Bangladeshi garment suppliers say they are being pushed to the brink, forced to fire workers and repay bank loans of millions for clothes shipped to Australia but never paid for.

title.children: Aussie fashion giant's collapse leaves Bangladeshi workers jobless

image.altText: printouts of a photo of a man wearing a face covering

props.synopsis: Authorities say the man who lit a blaze before fatally shooting two firefighters in north-western Idaho was a 20-year-old transient who once aspired to become a firefighter.

title.children: Idaho man who ambushed fire crews wanted to be a firefighter, sheriff says

image.altText: A man holds his hand in front of a sprinkler which is spraying water on a green lawn in front of a sandstone building

props.synopsis: Temperatures in some parts of Western Europe exceed 46 degrees Celsius, with fires burning in two countries and respite from the heat not expected for at least a few days.

title.children: 'Remarkable' heatwave has authorities on alert across Europe

image.altText: Cassius pictured at a horse track

props.synopsis: In Western Australia, two First Nations families are on parallel tracks, seeking justice for their teenage sons taken from them before their time. The boys should have been safe and protected — but weren't.

title.children: As two mothers mourn their sons, the silence of legislators speaks volumes

image.altText: A composite image of three men wearing formal suits standing side by side.

props.synopsis: When PNG's anti-corruption watchdog was established two years ago, there were high hopes it would mark a turning point but now the Australian and New Zealand bosses have been suspended.

title.children: Australian anti-corruption bosses suspended after 'chaotic' feud

image.altText: A portrait photograph of a woman with dark hair.

props.synopsis: Lung cancer is the number one cause of cancer deaths in Australia, but it's not just a smokers' disease. A new trial is targeting early detection across three different groups.

title.children: In hospital for appendicitis, Nicole left with a suspected cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A young woman with long hair wearing a black hoodie stands on a balcony in front of trees

props.synopsis: Analysis of data from the Department of Social Services shows a sharp decline in the number of students who receive support to study.

title.children: The number of students on Youth Allowance has dropped significantly

image.altText: Back of a woman sitting on a brick wall outdoors

props.synopsis: An Indigenous family has taken NSW Police to the Human Rights Commission arguing officers racially discriminated against two young Aboriginal boys by targeting them with excessive bail checks.

title.children: 150 police interactions later, this mum fears her sons have been 'targeted'

image.altText: A photo of Erin Patterson looking distressed.

props.synopsis: As a jury considers its verdicts in the Erin Patterson triple-murder trial, here's a recap of some of the evidence put before them.

title.children: As the jury retires, here's the evidence heard in Erin Patterson's trial

image.altText: A composite of catwalk looks: L, Kate Moss in a tartan dress; and R, a model in a large blonde wig, wearing a red dress.

props.synopsis: NGV's Yayoi Kusama broke records. The gallery is hoping to follow that success with its next summer blockbuster, showcasing the designs of Vivienne Westwood and Comme des Garçons founder Rei Kawakubo.

title.children: These two designers were born a year apart. They changed fashion history

image.altText: Peter Marks stands in front of his TV and two paintings, wearing an Adelaide Crows cap and scarf, holding a red toy football.

props.synopsis: WIN TV and Seven West Media fail to reach an agreement to show Channel 7 programming in parts of Australia's south-east, which a federal MP says could breach their licence conditions.

title.children: Channel 7-WIN TV dispute leaves station off air, distressing footy fans

image.altText: A small green bin sitting on a table.

props.synopsis: As green-lidded food organics and garden organics (FOGO) bins roll out across NSW, confusion about what should and shouldn't go in them means 45 per cent of what's collected across Australia still ends up in landfill.

title.children: Know what's a no-go in your FOGO bin? Many don't and that's a problem

image.altText: A yellow flag that says "open home" flying off a yellow real estate sign advertising an auction.

props.synopsis: Cotality's monthly index shows national prices climbing to a fresh peak in June, as interest rate cuts drove a broad-based upswing across Australia's property markets.

title.children: Record highs for home prices as rate cuts expected to fuel more growth

image.altText: A stylised graphic of the ASX board with an up arrow.

props.synopsis: For all the turbulence on the Australian stock market in recent months, you wouldn't have known it on June 30, with analysts hailing a "surprisingly good year" for the ASX 200.

title.children: Stocks climbed a 'wall of worry' to gain 10pc in 12 months. Where to from here?

image.altText: A woman in a cap and black shirt smiles at the camera, arms outstretched.

props.synopsis: Doctors disagree about who approved the transfer of a 42-year-old Tamworth woman from intensive care to a mental health unit, where she was later found dead.

title.children: Doctors give conflicting evidence at inquest into mother's death

image.altText: Alexei Popyrin congratulates Arthur Fery at the net

props.synopsis: Alexei Popyrin is one of multiple seeded stars to crash out of Wimbledon at the first time of asking in a nightmare opening day for Australians at the All England Club.

title.children: Popyrin 'numb' after being dumped out of Wimbledon by British world number 461

image.altText: Three generations of women sitting on a couch.

props.synopsis: For Canberra woman Belle Hogg, the first sign her life was about to change came when her mother forgot her birthday. Suddenly she found herself juggling full-time work, a photography business, raising her three children and caring for her mother.

title.children: Belle's aging mum forgot her birthday. It was the first sign of change

image.altText: iran strike

props.synopsis: Iran also criticises US President Donald Trump's comments on potentially striking Iran again and his shifting stance on whether to lift economic sanctions.

title.children: Iran raises death toll from war to 935, won't guarantee safety of nuclear inspectors

image.altText: A tank rolling through a dusty field, kicking up lots of dust.

props.synopsis: Despite hopes of a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, the Israeli Defense Force stepped up its latest offensive in the Palestinian enclave on Monday.

title.children: At least 58 killed as Israel intensifies offensive in Gaza

image.altText: A cardboard takeaway box on a picnic table holds golden, fried fish atop chips with a slice of lemon and tartare sauce.

props.synopsis: It is hoped new country of origin labelling for seafood on restaurant, cafe, and takeaway shop menus will give consumers certainty and help the Australian seafood industry in an import-dominated market.

title.children: Is your fish Australian or imported? New rules come in

image.altText: A woman sits on a couch and smiles.

props.synopsis: University students in regional Western Australia say study hubs are a lifeline for those completing higher education.

title.children: Why helping students study in home towns is critical to regional areas

image.altText: Composite image Jeremy Rockliff and Dean Winter.

props.synopsis: One of the first surveys of Tasmanians' voting intentions for the upcoming state election shows Labor could win more seats than the Liberals, and another minority government is on the cards.

title.children: Polling reveals voting intentions ahead of Tasmanian election

image.altText: A blonde woman in a black raincoat with glasses, holds her toddler daughter, in front of swings and a playground.

props.synopsis: After Victorian mother Elysha Clarke's petition for fencing around her local playground was rejected, she wants the council to build an all-abilities space to keep neurodivergent children safe.

title.children: Mother calls for inclusive playground after daughter's near-accident

image.altText: Three young people are leaning on a fence with farmland behind them.

props.synopsis: A program that offers students paid work and training on farms to help with workforce shortages is due to have its funding expire next year.

title.children: Teens learn how to run 800-cow dairy farm on their gap year

image.altText: Basketballer Caitlin Cunningham sits on the bench and smiles. She has short dyed black hair, two fangs, and dark eyeshadow

props.synopsis: Caitlin Cunningham, aka Caitlin "Dark", has attracted global attention for sporting full goth make-up on the basketball court — and they want others to embrace self-expression.

title.children: Basketballer going viral for goth make-up wants to show sport is for all

image.altText: A photo of P Diddy at the Met Gala wearing a black and white stripped suit

props.synopsis: After seven gruelling weeks, Sean 'Diddy' Combs's trial is coming to an end. But there are still a few more developments to unfold.

title.children: The Diddy trial is nearing its end. Here are the key moments from the past seven weeks

image.altText: A man shirtless on a stage singing into a microphone.

props.synopsis: UK police have also launched a criminal investigation into both Bob Vylan and Irish rap band Kneecap's performances at the popular summer festival.

title.children: US revokes visas for Bob Vylan over 'death to IDF' chant at Glastonbury
